strIntroduction: KKday will bring you to discover the beautiful Mountain Kinabalu, famous Poring Hot Spring, natural fish spa, mysterious Canopy Walk and the BEST roasted wild roar!

Make your way to the district of Kuala Penyu and hop on a boat to Pulau Tiga! The island’s claim to fame is none other than being the first ever ‘secret’ location for the hit reality series, ‘Survivor’. Hence, many refer to Pulau Tiga as Survivor Island. Located just 10km off shore on the West Coast of Sabah, you can enjoy a day trip to the island but many recommend spending at least a night or two.
strTitle: Day Trip to Snorkel and Jungle Trek at Pulau Tiga

strIntroduction: This evening tour takes you southwest of the city, travelling through the rural countryside. Reaching Kuala Selangor Wetland Reserve, you will be rewarded with a breathtaking scenery of the mangrove forests, home to an incredibly nocturnal beetle commonly called firefly.

Tunku Abdul Rahman Park, not only suitable for snorkeling, diving and other water sport activities, it is also a good spot for fishing. Enjoy a great day of fishing even it is only a short boat ride away. Rich in marine life and natural wonders, a fishing trip to Tunku Abdul Rahman Park exposes even the most seasoned fisherman to prized ocean catches such as Garoupa fish, Red Carp fish, Catfish and more.

Escape from the heat and noise and head to the tranquil Lake Garden, where you will find a stunning Orchid Garden, Butterfly Park and Bird Park.

Take a trip to Putrajaya, Malaysia’s smart city in the garden. Stretching over 11,320 acres, this picturesque township is famed for its innovative and distinctive design, harmonizing nature and development.

Mantanani Islands are a group of three isolated islands located northwest of Kota Belud. This place is well-known for the snorkeling spots and beautiful views underneath the ocean. Let's explore the natural wonderland with KKday.

strIntroduction: Enjoy an exciting day out as you set off for Forest Research Institute Malaysia or FRIM, and discover the wonders of the tropical rainforest. Founded by the British colonial forest scientist in 1929, FRIM offers a back-to-nature experience whilst enjoying the flora and fauna in a natural ecosystem. Within this fascinating institute, there are jungle trails, canopy walkway, waterfalls, a library and a museum, housing a small collection of the nation's rich forest heritage.
We will bring you to the tourist sites at the northern side of Borneo, included in bee farms, gong factory, Runggus Longhouse and Tip Of Borneo. You can enjoy beautiful sea and local cultures here!

strIntroduction: Kudat is a place with lower tourists' attention over the years, which is why it could preserve its nature within. The coral reefs here are preserved the best and its beauty could be same par with corals in Semporna nearby islands.
